summary: An email from attorney Sigrid McCawley to an unspecified recipient, relaying a report from her anonymous client about a suspicious white Sprinter van parked near the client's home. The client's electronic devices malfunctioned when she walked past the van, which she and her fianc√© observed. The attorney forwards this information in case it correlates with other similar incidents.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP who is sending an email on behalf of her anonymous client to report a suspicious incident involving a white van.

events.title: Suspicious van incident
events.description: An anonymous client of Sigrid McCawley reported that when leaving her home, she noticed a white Sprinter van with commercial plates and tinted windows parked nearby. As she walked past it, her phone malfunctioned briefly, made a weird noise, and her earphones 'blew out' and stopped working.

keyFacts: An attorney reported a client's concern about a suspicious white Sprinter van causing electronic device malfunctions.
The incident occurred on or about Wednesday, August 12, 2020, based on the email date of August 17, 2020.
The client is proceeding anonymously, suggesting sensitivity or fear related to the Epstein matter.
The attorney's firm is Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, which has been involved in high-profile litigation.
The email is marked as confidential and subject to attorney-client privilege.
